means: 离开( leave的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: As I sidestepped, the bottle hit me on the left hip.
sentence.Network_cn: 我侧一步要躲闪的时候，瓶子打中了我的左髋部。

sentence.Network_en: I picked first all the people who usually were left till last.
sentence.Network_cn: 我先挑出了所有通常留到最后的人。

sentence.Network_en: She dusted herself down and left to build her own career.
sentence.Network_cn: 她重振旗鼓去开创自己的事业了。

phrase.cizu_name: left, right, and centre (亦作 left and right 或 right

lj.lj_ly: deals were being done left, right, and center.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lyft, left 'weak' (the left-hand side being regarded as the weaker side of the body), of West Germanic origin

entry.def: Left is the past tense and past participle of leave .
If there is a certain amount of something left, or if you have a certain amount of it left, it remains when the rest has gone or been used.

example.ex: He's got plenty of money left...

entry.def: The left is one of two opposite directions, sides, or positions. If you are facing north and you turn to the left, you will be facing west. In the word 'to', the 't' is to the left of the 'o'.

example.ex: In Britain cars drive on the left.
...the brick wall to the left of the conservatory...

entry.tran: 左边的；左面的；左侧的；用在左边的
entry.def: Your left arm, leg, or ear, for example, is the one which is on the left side of your body. Your left shoe or glove is the one which is intended to be worn on your left foot or hand.
You can refer to people who support the political ideals of socialism as the left. They are often contrasted with the right, who support the political ideals of capitalism and conservatism.

example.ex: The government's industrial policy has been fiercely attacked by the left.
example.tran: 政府的工业政策遭到了左派的猛烈抨击。

entry.def: If you say that a person or political party has moved to the left, you mean that their political beliefs have become more left-wing.

example.ex: After Mrs Thatcher's first election victory in 1979, Labour moved sharply to the left...
example.tran: 1979年撒切尔夫人首次大选获胜后，工党的路线明显左转。

example.ex: There will be a radical swing to the right or the left.
example.tran: 将出现极左或极右的情况。

means.word_mean: 1. location near or direction toward the left side; i.e. the side to the north when a person or object faces east;
2. those who support varying degrees of social or political or economic change designed to promote the public welfare
3. the hand that is on the left side of the body;
4. the piece of ground in the outfield on the catcher's left
1. being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north;

sentences.sentence: "the left bank of a river is bank on your left side when you are facing downstream"
"she had a little money left over so she went to a movie"

means.word_mean: 4. of or belonging to the political or intellectual left
1. toward or on the left; also used figuratively;

auth_sentence.content: When she left, politicians spoke of little else.
auth_sentence.res_content: When she left, politicians spoke of little else.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When she left, politicians spoke of little else.

auth_sentence.content: It is wrong to have left the deaf behind.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is wrong to have left the deaf behind.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is wrong to have left the deaf behind.

auth_sentence.content: Corner taken by Rowan Vine from the left by-line.
auth_sentence.res_content: Corner taken by Rowan Vine from the left by-line.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Corner taken by Rowan Vine from the left by-line.

Sentence.sentence: When she died in 1916 she left her children 100 million dollars.
The only thing left to do is set up the microphones and speakers. They'll be here in a few minutes.
there's little time left for leisure activities for many Americans
The first four contestants won only small prizes, but the fifth left with a new luxury car.
She left her own car in Manchester
They have little time left to renew contact with their brothers and sisters.

means.word_mean: 左边, 左侧, 左部

sentences.en: Make a left at the corner.
sentences.cn: 到下一个拐角处向左拐。

sentences.en: I caught him on the chin with a straight left.
sentences.cn: 我用左拳击中他的下巴。

sentences.en: He is on the Left of his party.
He is blind in the left eye.

means.word_mean: 左边的, 左面的, 左方的

sentences.en: My house is on the left side of the street.
sentences.cn: 我的家在这条街的左侧。

sentences.en: Our company made a sudden charge on the left wing of the enemy.
sentences.cn: 我们连对敌人左翼发动了突袭。

jushi.english: Each line is flush on the left with the lines about and below.
jushi.chinese: 每一行的左边都上下对齐。

jushi.english: Go down the street and then turn to the left in the end.
jushi.chinese: 顺着这条街走到头,然后向左拐。

jushi.english: I caught him on the chin with a straight left.
jushi.chinese: 我用左直拳击中他的下巴。
